newsitem.title: UK: DIARY - Today in Westminster - Dec 3.
newsitem.headline: DIARY - Today in Westminster - Dec 3.

text.p: The House of Commons winds up its debate on the budget on Tuesday with a closing speech just before 2200 GMT from its author, Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke.
Other final-day contributions will come from Deputy Prime Minister Michael Heseltine, deputy Labour leader John Prescott and shadow chief secretary to the Treasury Alistair Darling.
- Questions to the Health Secretary at 1430 GMT.
- Prime Minister's questions at 1515 GMT. - Treasury officials give evidence to the Treasury Committee on economic prospects and tax/spending policy. 1045 GMT
- Foreign Office minister David Davis gives evidence to the European Legislation committee on progress of the European Union's Intergovernmental Conference. 1100 gmt.
